alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Glynn, eastern Brantley and southeastern Wayne Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms training along a line extending from 6 miles south of Tibet to near Raybon. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Everett, Waynesville, Thalmann, Atkinson and Mount Pleasant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Wayne
